brainvr.reader 0.1.1

Reference

Objects

Definitions of main objects

BrainvrObject()

Title

Loading functions

Functions to load brainvr-framework data

load_experiment()

Loads files form a folder into BrainvrObject

load_experiments()

Goes through the folder and loads every experiment info into separate object

load_experiment_info()

Loads particular info file into a list

load_experiment_log()

Loads expeirment log into a predefined list

load_result_log()

Loads results log at a specific path

open_brainvr_logs()

Generic loading of all the results, experiment and other logs

open_experiment_infos()

Searches the directory for experiment log files. Returs single one if multiple are found

open_experiment_logs()

Iterates over all _test_ files in a folder asnd saves them one by one to a return list

open_player_log()

Searches a directory for a player log. Returns player log data.table

open_result_log()

Searches for results logs and returns loaded list.

Getter functions

Functions to access BrainvrObject properties (get_log) and calculated results (get_trial_distance)

get_log()

Returns entire player log

get_trial_distance()

Returns walked distance in a particular trial

get_trial_duration()

Returns how long the trial took and removes potential pauses in the log

get_trial_event_times()

Returns times of certain events happening in particular trials

get_trial_log()

Returns data.table with player log for a particular trial

get_trial_position()

Returns navr_object with data for a particular trial

get_trial_times()

Gets start and finish times of trial

get_position_timewindow()

Returns log between designated times

get_distance_timewindow()

Returns amount of moved distance in given timewindow

get_experiment_log()

Returns experiment log data

get_experiment_settings()

Returns experiment settings in a list

get_finished_trials()

Returns which trials were finished

was_trial_force_finished()

Returns if the trial has been force finished

Preprocessing functions

function to preprocess mostly player log, transpose axes, smooth positions, and save

preprocess_player_log()

Preprocesses player log and returns it

export_position_log()

Exports preprocessed player log

smooth_positions(<brainvr>)

Smooths positions and recalculates distances

mirror_axes()

Mirrors X and Y to negative and recomputes rotation

resize_layout()

Resizes the map to fit the new constraints.

translate_positions()

Moves all positions to correspond to the new 0, 0 coordinate

save_preprocessed_player()

Saves preprocessed player ot hte given folder. Receives either specific name, or gets the name from already present player logs If there are multiple player logs in the folder,takes the name from the first available

Visualisations

Functions to visualise aspects fo the position. Mostly wrappers around navr visualisation functions

plot_trial_path()

Plots trial path
